intro: Anthacanthus microphyllus, commonly known as the small-leaved anthacanthus, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces a modest amount of seeds that are dispersed by wind. The plant has a relatively short lifespan, often completing its life cycle within one growing season.
